metadata.title: CVE-2020-27759 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
In IntensityCompare() of /MagickCore/quantize.c, a double value was beingcasted to int and returned, which in some cases caused a value outside therange of type `int` to be returned. The flaw could be triggered by acrafted input file under certain conditions when processed by ImageMagick.Red Hat Product Security marked this as Low severity because although itcould potentially lead to an impact to application availability, nospecific impact was shown in this case. This flaw affects ImageMagickversions prior to 7.0.8-68.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27759` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
imagemagick-6.q16 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
imagemagick-common - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
libimage-magick-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
libimage-magick-q16-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
libmagick++-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
libmagick++-6.q16-5v5 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
libmagickcore-6-arch-config - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
libmagickcore-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
libmagickcore-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
libmagickwand-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
libmagickwand-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
perlmagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11').
